skillTree.localised_description: Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit can fly.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.

skillTree.localised_description: Mighty, horned, reptilian beasts, Stegadons are naturally armoured with bony scales and spikes protruding from their crests.

skillTree.localised_description: Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.

skillTree.localised_description: Whereby the terrain itself is both shield and weapon, enabling the Lizardmen to both mask their numbers and surprise the foe.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: Some Lizardmen are able to seamlessly blend in with their jungle environment in order to observe, or defend themselves from, their enemies.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

skillTree.localised_description: Lizardmen can move with deceptive speed and agility when they have to.
Across the gulf of space, the serene Potec has shared the secrets of time so that the Lizardmen may protect themselves against supernatural attack.

effects.description:
Ambush defence chance: +5%
	(all units in army)

Ambush defence chance: +10%
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: It is the duty of a Skink Chief not only to obey, but also to notice and adapt.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.localised_description: The Skink Chief keeps the supply lines running and sees the will of the priests done.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(own armies in province)

skillTree.localised_description: Some spawning are stronger and more resilient than others.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Coordinating with a team of Skinks, the Chief keeps eyes on the entire province.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +5% for armies
	(own armies in province)

Campaign line of sight: +10%
	(own characters in province)

skillTree.localised_description: Some are marked by the Old Ones for greatness.
The Slann pass their enigmatic orders to the priests, who then turn to the chiefs. The chiefs get the job done.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -4% for all buildings
	(local province)

Horde building construction cost: -4%
	(own armies in province)

skillTree.localised_description: The Jaguar God grants agility and speed.
Large, for a Skink.

skillTree.localised_description: Able to take a hit or two without giving ground.

skillTree.localised_description: It is not a Skink Chief's duty to fall in battle, but to live and direct the warriors in all battles.

skillTree.localised_description: Capable of giving out orders and adapting to any situation.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 5% for Skinks units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Whilst one brother lives in darkness, the other, his double-twin, exists in light. Behold!"
"By your scales be you blessed by the divine protector."

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Saurus Infantry and Temple Guard units
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Brother of Great Tlazcotl, Tepok of the Air shall always be honoured. Let it be done."
"Cousin of darkness, Huanchi's priests too shall dwell in twilight."

effects.description:
Double experience gain when fighting against Dark Elves
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The universe resides within his reflective eyes; embrace the coldness of blessed certainty."
"Creator-meld of the beast, Itzl be praised!"

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Ancient Salamander, Stegadon, Bastiladon, Coatl, Dread Saurian, Feral Troglodon and Carnosaur units
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: So much of war is an art. Over time and with much practice, combat moves can resemble a series of perfectly-rehearsed dance moves.
This being fights dirty, no honour system applies here!
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
Whether a targeted slice to the throat, or a precision stab to the heart, this one knows how to kill!
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
Always on the lookout for an opening or advantage in battle - somewhere to put the knife in…
Always willing to fight on, a widened quiver allows arrows to rain, almost without end.
A drawn blade should not be put away until slaked in blood.
The smiths have already completed their order, the workers are in position and the masons are ready to begin.
True experience is born only on the battlefield.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -2% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Hero's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -4% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Hero's army)

	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It’s difficult to sleep with one eye open and a dagger under your pillow.
Sometimes it’s best to have friends in low places.
Always watching.

skillTree.localised_description: They’ve all heard the stories of this one’s accomplishments. The stories, of course, pale in comparison to the truth.

	(own characters in region)

Enemy Hero action success chance: -5%
	(own characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

skillTree.localised_description: Such magic-users may be wise and able to offer sage advice, especially if they have scried the region.

Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 4%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 6%

skillTree.localised_description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-important and opinionated, this one's hubris knows no end.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can block projectiles regardless of its facing.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-effacing and unpresuming, he believes that we all have a part to play in the Great Plan, one way or another.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "What are you even for? You're not part of the Great Plan, like all your kind."
"The Plan is the Plan. We shall not deviate or retreat from its path."

	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +25%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty

Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Chiefs report directly to the priests for orders, and are left to execute the commands issued to them by the priests. They are efficient, clever, and tireless in the performance of their duties.
